intro: Linaria crinita, commonly known as the hairy toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces slender, hair-like seed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Linaria crinita thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
